poem:
**Tracks Rewritten**

The underground thrums with delayed promise,  
a metal serpent unwound from its strike—  
copper and cadence, rhythms unsunk.  
Peace tripped on the last breath of Friday,  
where ink rebalanced scales in tunnel dark.  
Silent breaks the machine's fated roar—  
a whispered detour to Monday's dawn.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "RMT union calls off tube strikes planned for coming week Members of the RMT union at London Underground have called off plans to strike over the coming week, as transport officials urged tube train drivers to follow suit. The RMT said it had suspended its planned week-long action, which had been due to begin on Friday evening, after receiving a significantly improved pay offer from tube bosses. Aslef, the train drivers’ union, has yet to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
